text: Bottle. Pours dark red-amber with a shallow, off-tan head. Nose is sharp with grapefruit, spruce, and lavender. Odd amber ale; its both quite sweet and very very hop-crisp-sharp, and manages to hold the dichotomy of being both at once. Weird; its like an optical illusion for your tongue.

Dark amber with small white head. Aroma is malt, yeast. Taste is hops, flowers, some caramel. Little sweet, little to medium bitter. Bitter aftertaste. A bit watery. Very easily drinkable. Average beer.
330ml bottle. Pours orange. Honey, apricot, biscuit, coconut, toffee, quite sweet. Decent body. Decent beer.

330ml bottle. Pours hazy amber, small off-white head. Fruity and flowery nose. Red currant, hibiscus, rose hip, red tea, caramelly sweetness in aroma. Taste is dry, bittersweet, heather, caramel. Very dry mildly hoppy aftertaste, some wateriness. Medium bodied, average carbo. Smells nice, taste is not so pleasant.
12 ounce bottle.Slight scent of citrus, hoppiness. Cloudiness,medium amber in color..taste somewhat astringent this has an aftertaste Overall average amber ale. Happy New Years!
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Really enjoyed this. Reminded me of Anchor Steam a little. Fresh and crisp. Malt centric but with a decent hop bite. Citrusy. Beautiful color and a nice head. Nice body.

A 330ml bottle, packaged on 24th May 2016, to be enjoyed within 12 months. Poured into a Mikkeller pint glass. It poured a clear copper amber colour with a one finger off white head that had pretty good retention and eventually settled to a nice thin layer while leaving nice lacing. Aromas were malty, caramel, tea leaves and maybe a touch of honey. But its all really quite light. Tastes like sweet biscuit malt with touches of caramel, wood, breadiness and lemon here and there. Crisp, light to medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall mouthfeel was great with nice crispness and tingly carbonation, but the aromas were too light and I really had to search for them. Taste was normal and drinkable. Not bad, but not quite my type of beer.
Poured from the tap at Lens. Orangey brown with off white head. Lots of sweet malt and perfumey notes, mild caramel and citrus, light dry hop finish.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ Sake Okadaya, Nagoya, Japon.
A: Amber / Ambar.
T/S: Roasted malt, sweet / Malta tostada, dulce.

( ABV 6% ) Smell: malt, grape, hops.
Taste: a little bit of sour, pronounced bitterness, fruits; aftertaste - bitterness and yeast. 
Color: of tea with light creamy head.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a bright amber color with a large white head. A big yeasty nose, toffee and tea. A soft palate, sweet toffee, English bitter elements, some caramel, floral notes. Quite nice. Doughy.

from Erzbierschof - hazy dark amber-orange beer with a firm long lasting beige foam; perfumy malty and caramelish aroma with notes of earth and red fruits; full-bodied, light grainy texture and quite bitter aftertaste of blackcurrant and nuts - nice

reddish amber, little hazy, fruity, grainy, some pine in aroma; medium bitterness, slightly sweet; medium body, sticky dusty feel, average carbonation, moderately long and quite sharp(?) bitter finish;
Overall: nice aroma but the taste and palete could (should) be better

(Baird Red Rose Amber Ale) Bottle 330 ml, served into a shaker, ABV 6%
Amber coloured body, murky and with big chunks of yeast floating around.One finger of thin and a bit frothy tan head on top, with good retention.
Aroma of light red fruits, caramel, light spices.
Nice taste, with caramel, some spices again,niuts, faint fruity notes, with nice and long bitterness on the finish.
Medium body, good carbonation.
Good.

Pours cloudy light coppery or kind of red/brown. Some light beige top and lasing. Aroma- toasted malts, some choco cake like sweetness, tiny notes of cocoa. Flavor more reminds some brown ale with tiny touch of sour in the back and some choco cake notes. Low to none hops bite (pack date 05.03.14.). Medium doby, thick sticky texture, mid carbonation.
On tap @ Haket Pub. Reddish amber with a heavy off white head. Fruity and flowery tones. Fruit, flowers, malt and hops. Medium body with a nice bitter sweet finish.
Pour is a slightly hazy amber, thin head. Nose smells like cooking wort.; malt central. Bittersweet. Middle is nice amber malt. Finish is a hint of wood overpowered by malt.
Tap. Cloudy, orange, frothy, white foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & bitter finish.

Bottle from Uba ja Humal in Tallinn. Package date ca 7 months ago. Hazy coppery amber colour. The heads big, creamy white, retains and laces nicely. On the nose its kinda strangely reminiscent of leavened (soured) cabbage - the aroma is rather faint unfortunately, but has this pretty interesting mix of sweet and sour. Not saying Im enjoying it or looking for this in my beer, but at least its interesting. The distinct fruity Steam beer aroma is there as well, more so as it warms. Tastes of modest fruitiness and rather harsh, even unbalanced bitterness. Finishes rough... metallic, grapefruit peel bitter, yet somehow lagery... Mediumish body, rather active carbonation. Ive had a couple of excellent California Commons - this upside-down version does not beat them. Curiously, it kinda reminds me of some Bitters. Which Im not a fan of. Extra point for inventiveness.

330ml bottle. Clear dark amber color. Medium size, beige head, stays. Grainy, faint metallic, nutty oiliness, bit dusty, slightly sour notes in aroma. Grainy, light hops, very faint red currant, dusty taste. Fizzy carbonation. Grainy aftertaste. Weird herbal bitterness.
Aroma of malt, caramel, red fruits, herbal notes, hops. Flavour is moderate sweet with a medium bitter finish. Nice balance between malts, fruits and hops.

330ml bottle from Deguchiya in Nakameguro. Poured into a snifter. Pours a hazy orange color with an off-white head. Head is finely carbonated but dissipates fairly quickly. Cinnamon, clove, malts, prune, grape on the nose. Big malty sweetness with grape and prune on the palate. Sweet with a slightly bitter finish. Also some pepper and nutmeg on the finish.

Amber beer, tan head. Nose is caramel, some hoppy notes, malt, mild toasty notes. Flavor is malt with caramel hints. Watery palate, thin for the ABV. Very drinkable, very forgettable. Shared by martjoobolut, thanks!

0,33L bottle (from Koht), 6% ABV. Pours dark amber with beige head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is sweet, some sourness, malt, and some fruits. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, dry bitterness, some alcohol, and some metallic notes. Finish is also dry bitter. Overall: ok-ish.

Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours hazy amber with white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, yeasty-bready, Taste the same, caramel,maybe slightly hopped. 
Nothing special.

Bottle to tulip
Aroma of plum, caramel, grapefruit, flowers, and malt. Cloudy amber with lots of particulates and a frothy 1 cm frothy head with some dark dreggy bits and good retention. Taste is plum, grapefruit, a little funk, dry bitterness at the end. Kind of tastes like a fruity English bitter. It has (not surprisingly) a chalky palate.
liquid is clear brown with thick head, tastes lightly sour, medium bitterness,
Bottle from Yamaoka. Ruby colour, small head. Spicy, caramel, hop aroma. Flavour has some nice citrus hops along with some spice and malts.
Grain and Grape bottle (14-Oct-2014)Sweet fruit spice aroma.Brown red,low head&suds lace.Spicy fruit rose flavour.Bitter fruit spice aftertaste.
Herbal hop spice aroma. Clear Amber colour good head and lacing. Malt citrus hop herbal flavour. Smooth palate.

Aroma: fresh hop aroma with a good balance of sweet crystal malt
App: amber red and hazy with the yeast added tan head sheet lacing.
Flavour: initial hop bitterness giving way to sweet malt
Palate: finishes with long hop bitterness

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: OCT 15, 2015 An impressive beer that provides a full bodied well balanced taste in a close to session-able strength.

Bottle. Aroma malty, honeyish, biscuity. Light citrusy hoppiness. Light diacetyl. Lightly hazy deep amber colour. Balanced taste, caramelly biscuity maltiness up front, resiny hoppiness later, moderate bitterness. Long resiny finish.
on tap at the taproom in tokyo. clear amber with a lingering off-white head, loads of lacing; aroma of caramel and citrus; decent whack of bitterness, gold bricks, pine, floorboards; pleasant

This was poured into a pint glass.
The appearance was a nice hazy amber to brown color with a decent one finger white foamy head that dissipated within less than a minute. There was some light to somewhat foamy lacing trying to stick to the sides but it slides for the most part.
The smell was pretty good as it had a nice blend of sweet caramel malts to sweet citrusy fruits. 
The taste was mainly sweet through everything combined. There was a pretty good sweet aftertaste that lead to a dry finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a pretty good sessionability about it. The carbonation seems appropriately styled and was pretty good all around. 
Overall, well gee. Ive been having some Amber/Red ales lately and a fair amount of them just have seemed to be on par but this one because of the hoppiness that comes out but still doesnt come across as overbearing, Id take this one over a fair amount of other Red ales these days.

Visual: 100% Japanese label other than the name,a true import. But I had to go to the specialty liquor shops in Japan to find Baird beers. Pours cloudy iced tea brown with a nice sized foamy head, a thin layer of retention, some lacing, several steady singular streams.

Nose: clean, medium-sweet caramel malts. Very nice. (lvl-8)-pungency

Attack: creamy-smooth mouthfeel

Mid-palate: fizzy-tingly, (lvl-6)-sweetness, (MAIN) caramel malts, light cocoa, almost milky

Finish: soft medium bitter pine hops + cocoa finish.

Summary: Crazy smooth and easy-sipping. Once again Im surprised at the fact I finished this beer in under 5 minutes just tasting it.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch fruchtig hopfig, blumig, Karamell. Geschmack fruchtig, hopfig, blumig, leicht hefig, Karamell.
Bottle. Ruby red body, light head, beautiful sweet hop aroma with boozy tones, complex malty taste with sweet tropical notes. Truly fantastic! Lovely beer!

Bottle at Butters SlutFest 2011 on 04/23/2011. Clear amber body with a small creamy off white head. Sweet malt and light floral aroma. Sweet caramel and light floral and tea flavor. Medium body with moderate carbonation.

Bottle at The Foundry (Mohamed Sultan Rd), Singapore, 5.5% ABVCloudy amber color with generous head. Aroma of malt and yeast, some caramel fudge candies. Smooth mouthfeel; pleasant flavor of caramel fudge (more caramel than fudge); correct bitterness.Balanced, good beer.

360 ml bottle bought at YATA in Grand Century Place in Mong Kok.
Cloudy hazy dark amber red colour with chocolate-colour dirt like yeast sediments; One finger head with beautiful, crumpety off white foam which lasts for 2 minutes; Excellent sticky lacing with slight carbonation; Quite fragrant sweet aroma of full ale malt, with dark fruit, honey, chocolate, caramel, bread, yeast, light lemon and grass; Mid to light sweet taste of full ale malt, with very light grapefruit, faint cherry, dry biscuits, bread, yeast, molasses, liquorices, lime and grassy hops; Medium body, quite thick and slick palate; Mouth feel is full Ale - close to Premium Bitter - with pretty sharp German Pils-like bitterness. Minimal sweetness, thin but notable red fruits, bone-dry and bready, thick and slick. I like it! Hoppiness is red fruit and like grass nose, limey and herbal grass taste. Good dose of liquorices for a pretty licking bitter finish; Very dry after taste, crisp and nicely bitter to mouth.

Comments: As a Cali Common, this one is a bit simple in taste variety, but the looks, body, aroma, dryness and bitterness are as good as they can get. No detour or bumpy ride throughout, very enjoyable all the way. Recommended of course!

Bottle at Stus flat. Deep copper body with a medium off-white head. Lively carbonation. Excellent lacing. Aroma of caramel, wood and summer fruits. Flavour of toffee apple, wood, plum and faint citrus. Medium body with a chewy mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Expensive but tasty.
A touch of spice and some off-fruity hops. Dark amber color, kind of cloudy. Sweet overall taste, a bit bitter and starchy. Smooth, slick body. From the far side of San Francisco...

5.5% half-pint at CBB. Nice cloudy amber honey color with a thin filmy head. Caramel & some sort of herbal/spice quality I cant pin down in the aroma. The body is smooth but thin with a very light carbonation. The taste is lightly bitter, acidic with a bit of caramel in the finish. An ok ale, slightly bitter but fairly well balanced.

Draught @ Bungalow. Dark amber, off-white head. Resiny hops and ripe oranges in the nose. Medium body, fine carbonation. Not as fruity as I expected, but still has some nice flavours of fruit and caramel. Restrained bitterness, nice clean finish. Decent.

Poured a hazy dark brown amber colour with a two-finger off white foamy head that retained well and laced well. Low carbonation. Aroma very slightly of floral hops and not much else. Taste mild semi-sweet malt fading to mild hops. Light body. Short, crisp, mild hops bitterness finish.

330 ml bottle. First off, this bottle was either way over-carbonated or didnt travel well, frothing out when opened. Eventually it pours a clear red-amber with a fluffy white head. Aromas of lemon zest, noble hops and dark bread. Taste is definitely malt driven, but with an overlay of lemony hops. Fruity finish. Smooth and quite enjoyable.

Off tap and takeaway bottle from Numazu taproom. Deep cloudy amber pours with light brown medium head. Head dissipates fairly quickly. More flavour as it warms a bit from the fridge. Deep caramel Malts with rose water and well balanced bitterness.
Bottle. 10th California Common rating - Take two. Pours dirty caramel amber. Off white head. Nose and taste of steam, bready malt, malted barley, mixed nuts and mixed dried fruit. Medium body.
Tap at Bashamichi Taproom, Yokohama. Red colour with a white head. Lacing. Fruity aroma. Flavour is fruity, floral, some caramel.
Draft at the source. Cloudy orange amber color, thick whitebhead with good retention and solid lacing. Aroma od taste of fruit.

Pours amber with a quickly fading head.
Nose shows caramel, bready malt and some resinous hops. Nice malt character.
Malty flavours too. Bready malt and sweet syrupy notes. A fair bit of resinous earthy hops too, along with an assertive, well-balanced bitterness.
Carbonation could be a bit higher.

The aroma is malty, caramel, flowers and citrus.  Hazy red/amber appearance, off-white head.  The flavor is caramel, bready, flowers.  The finish is flowers, citrus.  Medium/thick in body.  Very nice.  The crispness of a lager, and the fruity qualities of an ale.
Bottle. Hazy amber pour with a thick beige head. Malty nose with herbal and floral character and a bit of caramel. Malty flavor with herbs before an earthy finish.

20 feb 2013, bottle. orange/amber, hazy, steady bubbles, rocky head. nose is rose petals, toasted coffee beans, bready malt. med/thin body and moderately fizzy. champaigny yeast, some toast notes, light lager hops, faint tin notes. okay.

Rich amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of caramel malt, some yeast, hops, & fruit; Flavor of slight sweet malt, caramel, hops, and fruit; Dry finish; Nicely balanced; Pretty decent actually.
Dezent bitterer Antrunk mit leichten Grasnoten. Sehr trocken werdend, dann wieder etwas hopfiger, nur hintergründig würzig. Wechselhaftes und süffiges Bier. 11/11/11/9/8/9
Bottle, amber pour, medium bodied. Fruity caramel maltiness, touch of pine and citrus bitterness. Decent amber

Pours a hazy burnt copper with a fluffy, quickly disintegrating white head.  Smells like it looks--malt with a copper twang. It has a good balance but nothing extraordinary. Generally an average beer with metallic notes in color,  aroma and taste.

Pours a cloudy copper colour with big fluffy off white head leaving some lace up the glass and yeast on the bottom of the bottle. Aromas of toast, caramel, woody, and kinda earthy. Flavours of toasted malts, woody, caramel, grainy, light bitterness that lingers a little.
Bottle. Pours a hazy dark amber color with a smallish white head. Nose is rather fruity with a hint of sourness. Taste is also a tad sour with the fruitiness in there.

Bottle shared at Delirium Hoppy Loft.  Pours hazy amber with a medium tan head.  Aro a of malt, floral hops, light caramel and light fruit.  Flavour is light to moderate sweet and bitter.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Well, I was wondering why this was so dry and smooth until I logged on here to discover its a California Common, not an Amber. Its ok... the aroma is fantastic, with fresh hops digging deep through my nasal membranes. Taste is... what it is, though. The malts itch at the back of my throat. Hops give bitterness and no other flavour, really. Hefty cobwebs on the glass, like the seven dwarfs home when discovered by Snow White.

12oz bottle 8/22/12 (Binnys Downers Grove)-42° in Lager Glass-Pours a slightly hazy amber with a small off white head. Aroma of malt, citrus, hop, and pine. Taste of the same with more malt and hops. This medium bodied brew is not bad.
Draught at Country Boy. Amber beer. Caramel and toffee throughout the taste and aroma. Nicely hopped. Decent.
Bottle. Hazy dark brown colour with a white head. Aroma has hops and some pine. Soft mouthfeel and a slow start but the taste builds up eventually.  An average beer, nothing to see here.

360ml bottle. Poured a very deep amber, almost toffee colour with an off white foam that laces the glass. Roasted malt aroma with a bit of piney citrus thrown in. Strong in the mouth with good flavour.

Bottle (gift from Neko-chan). Dark sugary aroma with heavy hopping and yeast. Copper, light tan head. Hops and yeast sort of blend in mid palate. Long aftertaste, with a series of prickly hop touches on the tongue. Medium-heavy body. Very pleasant -- though maybe just a bit hop heavy for the style.

360ml brown bottle. Orangey pour, hazy. Head reduces itself to a thin creamy layer, slight off white colour. Thin splotches of random lacing. Light fruity nose, some malt sweetness, caramel. In the mouth the beer has light citrus, caramel and toasty malts. Finish has light hopping, dryish malt, grains, toasty notes, trace of grapefruit, some grassy sharpness. Average carbonation and light bodied. Usually a big fan of Bairds beers but this one is average.

330ml bottle pours a pale amber color with a finger of white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass.  Aroma is light fruits with citrus and pine and mild caramel.  Taste is caramel malty sweetness with a nice citrus and pine hop bitterness to round things out.  Light to Medium body with good carbonation leaving a pleasant tingle on the palate.  An above average amber ale that was a pleasure to have sampled.
nice deep amber, tastes far less complex than the aroma indicates. there is a surprising and not completely pleasant bitterness to the finish
Bottle with KMD and SED. Deep orange with a frothy tan head. Aroma of orange with light chocolate. Flavour is smooth even hop with a nutty caramel background.

Sample poured from bottle at Encinitas Ale House in Encinitas, CA. 

Hazy, sparkling, translucent orange copper with minimal head of finely bubbled foam.  Fair to good lacing. 

Intense floral aroma.

Taste is bitter and flowery with caramel and toffee malt.  Reminded me of hibiscus tea.  

Medium body and high carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lager glass.  Nice amber/orange color.  Tinted off-white head appears to be in it for the long haul.  Orange peel on the nose and maybe a little apple pie.  Perfect amount of hops for this.  Continued citrus peel and some spice, but overall a pretty good beer.

Bottle @ home. Aroma is very citrussy hops, touch of flower, lemon peel.
Flavour is smooth but sharp bitterness, lovely fruity and flowery hops, piney indeed, nice malt note. Awesome beer, would love this as a session beer. 
If anyone can send me a fresh 6pack please contact me!
Hazy amber coloer with big off-white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Good bitter fruity flavor.
0.36 l bottle. Hazy reddish brown color. Sweet aroma with nuts, caramel and strawberry. Sweetish nutty and toffeish flavor with erthy, herbal  and citrusy hops. Finishes bittersweet and nutty.

Bottle in Craft Beer Co. Colour is ruby brown, white head. Nose is malty, bread, ale fruity. Taste is distinctive but odd. Red currants, nutty, caramel. Its a crisp beer with citrous and caramel but a strong red currant and nutty flavour thats too strong.

A cloudy, reddish beer with a medium and beige head. Aroma is malty and fruitfull, quite sweet, toffee, and some herbs and mustyness. Taste is quite simple, some toffee, biscuity maltyness and dry, wooden hoppyness. Medium bodied, enough of carbonation, nice to drink. Nice aroma, then fruits are unfortunately disappeared. Anyway, quite fresh and easily to enjoyable.

365ml bottle (BierKompass.de)
7 Crisp refreshing, slightly piney hop aroma.
4 Hazy to cloudy deep orange, good tight bready head.
7 So bready, toasted rye bread, just a little bit burnt.
4 Crisp palate, carbonation quite high. Finish nicely toasted, again to the point of burnt bitterness. A touch of soapiness in the hops, thats about the only drawback.
13 Super easy quaffer, but jam packed full of the kinds of flavours you (or I) want in a beer. I could session this happily, and enjoy and appreciate every drop. 3 darn good and 1 decent beer out of 4 - these guys have really proved their worth.

Bottled 330ml (BB 11/2012)
Amber color, small off-white head. Ryeish, bready, hoppy aroma. Medium-bodied. Bready-ryeish flavor, a bit piney, Some sweetier notes in the background. Lingering bitter-sweet aftertaste. Quite American. Nice.

Bottled (from bierkompass.de). Amber colour, small slightly off.white head. Aroma is caramel, fruityness, nutty notes as well as some quite sweet floral hoppy notes. Flavour is mild toasted malts, some sweet floral notes, mild nuttyness as well as some hops. Ends in a semibitter way.
Bottle at Craigs house. bread, amber, hazy, minimal head, lightly bitter, light body, sticky, lively.
Bottle at home ... copper ... thin white head ... sweet toffee malts nose ... soft sweet american malts im not fond of ... juicy fruits ... sweet roast.. ok ....
Light brown coloured and hazy. Has a white head, mostly  lasting. Aroma is sweet, cerials, faint citrus too. Flavor starts sweet, finish moderate to heavy bitter. Dry texture and soft carbonation.
nice hoppy aroma,pale, clear, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, oily feel, lively, bitter, long finish.

Bottle: &nbsp Dirty caramel, moderate to large off-white head, frothy, fairly sticky lacing. &nbsp Soft hop 

nose, malty, a little bright. &nbsp Very soft malt and hop presense on the tongue. &nbsp I get that unflavored pixie 

stix sort of powdered sugar aspect. &nbsp Almost more of a Pale than an Amber in that it doesnt seem malty enough. 

&nbsp Body and mouthfeel are very average, a little sticky around the mouth towards the finish but otherwise very 

mild. &nbsp Has a bit of pale citrus peel on the finish. &nbsp Very non-descript for a beer, mid-way between Pale and 

Amber. &nbsp Nothing really stands out. &nbsp Others from Baird seem more interesting, but this one is very "ho-hum".

Draught at Naka Meguro taproom. Amber coloured with small white bubbly head. Aroma is very malty, bit of hops (b.o./cat pee). Taste is surprisingly bitter, crisp and prickly with a fruity malty finish. Very nice.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Hoppy Loft: hazy amber with an off-white head, light malt, definite yeast presence, yeasty, caramel, slightly fruity, floral, light spices, slightly sour & crisp, nice fluffy & easy but still very unique, maybe expected more but this is still pretty good

(360ml bottle) Purchased at Cook St Liquors. Nose is fairly flowery and waxy in aroma. Very deep colour for an amber. Flavor has a tinge of scotch upfront but works into a woody, bark finish. Very thin body but nice overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From YNWA, Kolding, DK.
Bottled, 010911.
Amber with white head. Aroma of malt and wood. Flavor with some caramel and fruit notes.

Bottle. Pours a deep hazy amber with a frothy tan head. Aroma of floral, fruit, and honey. Flavor is quite sweet. Medium body, slightly bitter malty finish. Overall I thought it was unique and I enjoyed it.
Botella. Hazy deep amber colour with an off-white head. Malty caramel fruit aroma, sweet. Good mouthfeel. Sweet fruity toasty malty flavour, pleasant bitterness.

Bottle courtesy of Mes.  Love that label - thanks, Mes!!!  I dont want to pay a huge luggage weight penalty, so I find I have to scarf down some of these bottles I have been given and bought before flying back to Canada - so here goes.  Average slightly hazy amber pour, smallish average off-white head.  Smells ... a lot maltier and yeastier than the steam beers I remember, but as a somewhat bitter not-too-sweet bitter, its pretty nice.  The taste - better than North American ambers, this has character - somewhat sweet and oily cereal malt body reasonably backed with moderate herbal/grassy bitterness - fairly well-balanced, a tad sweet - but it is very interesting, if maybe a touch papery.  Average pretty much everything about the palate with this one - wont blow your mind, wont offend you - I think youll enjoy it - I did.

Bottle from GBBF 2011.  Hazy russet colour with thin off white head.  Malty aroma.  Yep its a malty ale.  I quite like these amber ales.  Yes some bitter hops on end.  Tasty enough solid malty amber beer with some decent bitter hops.
Bottle courtesy HenrikSoegaard. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are caramel, citrus, fruits, malt and hops.
Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.
Hazy amber color with okay head. Very special beer, but not bad. Spicey and hoppy flavor.
amber, white foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter,
Bottle, pours hazy amber with medium off white head... aroma is sweet, caramel,fruit.... the flavor is fresh in start then some bitterness.....fruit, hops.... bitter finish....

Bottle. Pours hazy amber with a creamy steady off white head. The aroma is caramel, toasted malt, sweetness, fruit and some fruity hops. The flavour is fruity hoppy with notes of bread, toasted malt and citric hops. Nice balance and very drinkable.

Bottle, bought @ YNWA, Kolding.
Pours light hazy red-orange with a frothy, yellowish big head. Good duration. Aroma has grass, caramel, malts, hay. Lowish carbonation, fine light and rather dry mouthfeel. Flavour is a bit sharp for (what I thought was) an amber ale, caramel, light yeast, grass, peach. Dry piney in the finish. Overall, it is very drinkable and the steambeer category fits a lots better than amber ale in my book.

Bottle. High creamy and long laswting white head. Hazy amber body. Mild citrus peach grass caramel aroma. A bit thin bodied grass pine grapefruit flavor with caramel. Low carbonation. Bitter but short aftertaste.
Hazy dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma is malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and bitter finish. 020711
Bottle. Hazy amber  with medium off-white head. Flavour is malt, hops, little pine, fruit, bitter and caramel.

bottle from ølbutikken.
hazy orangebrown to amber, smooth large beige head. Very pleasant but quite faint aroma, malts, flowers, faint berries. nice aroma but too faint.
flavor is flowery, pine, caramel, malts, refreshing, dry,ends caramelly and hoppy bitter. good balance. Lots of flavor for the 5.4% ABV.
(Bottle 2/7-2011) < mobile > llow lasting head, slightly bitter, watery aroma,

Bottle at home.
Hazy orange red coloured with a medium sized off-white head.
Frutiy aroma of caramel and hops with notes of grass.
Fruity flavour of caramel, grass and hops.
Hoppy finish.

Bottle. Amber, hazy, small to average and mostly diminishing head.  Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, caramel and some fruitiness, some citrus hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and  sweetish flavor, fruitiness with caramel, faint citrus hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, caramel, faint citrus hoppyness. Sweetish amber ale with caramel  nothing special.
Bottled from Bierkompass. Amber color with creamy white head. Nice lacing. Aroma of fruits, pine, spices. Taste, citrus, hints of caramel, apples mabe. Grapefruit bitter finish. Nice.

Sampled on 6/2/2011. This California Common Ale pours a slightly hazy deep amber reddish color from a 12oz bottle. Medium sized white foamy head, with decent lacing and nice retention. The aroma is caramel, fruity and sweet. A medium bodied California Common. The malts are fruity, caramel and sweet, with a touch of tartness. The hops are floral and earthy. Nice carbonation. Decent balance. This beer has the malty sweetness of an amber and the soft mouthfeel of a steam beer. There is a touch of tartness here, kind of goes well with the other flavors. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and crisp. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.
Bottle at Butters Slutfest: Dried leaves and cumin, slight DMS. Cloudy orange, thick yellow head, good lacing. Flavor is cumin and lemon, subtle lemon zest. Not a bad amber.
Sampled at Slutfest 2.0.  Near clear amber copper pour with fair offhwite head. fairly standard, notihng offensive.  A little astringent and bitter on the tail.  Cool stainglass label as usual.

Bottle 360ml.Light unclear medium orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, caramel, fruity, light dusty chocolate and dusty cacao. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110408]

Bottle at Jan & Charlottes, Ulfborg, Denmark, 08.04.11 thanks Jan & Charlotte for this.   Pours amber with a white film on top. Smooth with a touch of cocoa. Easy drinking beer, goes well with our smoked fish. Nice bitterness throughout  A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov14   3.6
ambrata buojna schiuma piuttosto peristente naso legermente agrumato un tocco floreale amaro media discreto corpo beverina leggero caramello

A thick and long lasting tan head.  Dark brown.  Sticky hops with citrus and pine in the nose.  Those same hops begin the flavor.  More tart passion fruit follows.  There is also some raisin and caramel.  Some tart grapefruit bitterness.
From a bottle poured a light brown color with a fair amount of head.  Light bitter malty flavor with a quick finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Rather baker yeast aroma with some laurel. Hazy, reddish brown, irregular beige head, fair lace. Dry, bitter, yeast, some malts, hint of laurel. Rather nasty bitter in the finish. Alcoholic for only 5.4%. Unbalanced, hard to drink.
Middle of the road, typical for the style.  Some malt sweetness, light background almost tea-like.  Not horriible although not going to buy this again for the price.

Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy citrus aroma with hints of caramel. Fruity malty caramel flavor with hoppy citrus hints. Has a sweetish malty hoppy finish.

From notes:

Pours a deep dark ruby, almost chestnut brown color with a 1.5 finger frothy, off-white head. Decent retention, slowly fading into a lasting ring that leaves sporadic spots of lacing behind.

Floral aroma with subtle earthy hosp and light fruit presence.

Fuller boded than expected with a nice bitter hop presence up front thats followed by a sweet malt backbone and bitter dry finish. Subtle hints of flower petal along with slight roasted malt, chocolate and biscuit.

This is a really weird interpretation of the style. Full body with a stronger malt and hp profile than I expected. A bit more roasted and rich than most beers of the style yet balanced by earthy, floral and bitter notes.
Hazy, light red amber body with short head. Light caramel in the taste finishes with pine notes, very drinkable but doesnt do a lot for me.

Pours a murky orange/brown. Earthy hop aromas, with some citrus and dried fruits (pear and apricot). Solid toasty malt aromas, with vanilla, marshmallow and fudge. Slight sweatiness in the background. Flavour is a balance between upfront fruity esters, earthy/resinous hops and a chewy toasted malt character with doughy bread, fudge and caramel. Nice beer.

Bottle from 16th St. Liquor in West Vancouver. Pours amber, beige head, thick. Aroma is malty, hoppy with fresh citrus notes. Retains the familiar Baird yeast aroma. Taste, malty, followed by some floral sweetness, caramel malts, keep a good malt profile. Thin yeasty deposit in the bottle. Decent.

Pours a very dirty amber color that lets little light through. Minimal head that disappeared into a few big bubbles within the first minute of pouring.  Taste starts nice but finishes very bitter for an ale.  Very hoppy.  Bitter after taste on roof of mouth.

Bottle. Pours cloudy amber with a mild, though lingering white head. Light malt aroma with some bread and caramel. Sweet, with some toasted biscuit and malty sugar. Light to medium in body with average carbonation. Short, somewhat malty finish with easy bitterness. Not bad, easy drinking.

My first beer from Baird. Pours a dark amber color...almost brown with two fingers of off white head. Aroma is hops up front with citrus and malts also present. The dark color betrays the high malts in the taste. Quite an unusual taste with the bitter hops first and then the sweet smooth roasted malts. A great beer none-the-less.

This is quite hoppy, all the way through much like an ipa. The malts are thicker, there is a definate floral aftertaste for a bit, its not too bad but it tastes failry regular for all its complicated makings. Its a fine beer, but thick for the bitterness, and there is a % haning around afterwards though it seems it could do with more if you didnt taste it for so long.

Pours hazy and ruby red with a thin white head.  Aroma is very floral and hopy. Nice mouth feel, very creamy. Very hopy as well,with a strong pine like flavour as well excellent progression of flavour and an excellent bitter finish. This is a very nice brew. Interesting and unique.

Bottle, bought for me by Rockley at Zin in Calgary. Thanks buddy! Hazy amber brown, off-white head. Lightly toasty sweet malt aroma, with some citrus and floral hops. Body is a little chewy and a little toasty, with a really nice citrus and floral hop finish. ood balance, great flavours. Wouldnt have pegged this as a California common style, but it rocks anyway!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 12oz bottle dark thick amber brownish with foamy off white head, sediment. Aroma is flowery with caramel, toffee, nutty. Taste very nutty with molasses, vanilla, slight citrus/pine finish also a light coppery. Decent.
Sample at Wine World. Thick nut brown with a light tan head. Scent is hoppy. Taste is light hops and sweet malts. Bitter finish.

Bottled.  Poured rich, hazy brown with just as much dense off-white head.  The aroma picked up sweet, toasted caramel and nutty notes with accents of molasses and vanilla.. sweet overall, sporting some dusty yeast.  The flavor found some fruit along with caramel and molasses at the core.. dry and spicy at the back end, and I cant tell for the life of me where it came from.. bitter and sharp pine notes stuck on the finish.  Medium-bodied and well carbonated on the palate.. again sharp, but for no good reason.. OK stuff, but I dont need another.
Amber with a decent beige head. Aroma is of malt, honey and cardboard. Taste is of cardboard and malt.

Bootle. Pours a reddish deep amber. Good slightly rocky head. Some lacing. Aroma is all about the malt with plenty of caramel and bready malt. Some citrusy hops but these really are in the back ground. Flavours are much the same with plenty of malt sweetness. Good resiny bitter finish. Good beer

Very light tinge pink head of good size medium carbonation in dark amber to red brown pour aroma fruity malty caramel flavour citrus bitter like peel grapefruit caramel more like an IPa resinous taste vanilla nut touch finish even tastes that are pleasing strong bitter lasting but it tastes like an IPA

12 oz. bottle. Cookie to biscuit aroma. Chalk dryness. Candied flower smell. Pleasant but not outstanding or particularly strong aroma. Am I detecting Belgian-esque yeast? Pours a bronze to sable color, maybe with some copper. More light brown than amber in color. Hazy from the yeast. Large amount of surprisingly thick, uneven, long-lasting, light taupe-colored head. Produces good lacing. Dry taste. Low on flavor but not unpleasant. Cardboard. Some fruit that is hard to identify: Maybe pomegranate? Floral flavor. A touch of metal in the finish (not a good thing). Light body. Mineral water-like palate effects. Baird Red Rose Amber Ale probably is better than this score indicates, and it is interesting, but no more so than one would expect from a hybrid style like California Common.

(nice) cloying sweet aroma, very floral and fruity -- peaches and grapefruit.
blurry amber, thick frothy bright beige head.
flavor is much milder, lots of floral and some fruit, but slightly watery.
somewhat thin, carbonation got lost in the head, leaves mild boring finish.

( 12oz bottle thanks to bu11zeye) Pours cloudy orange with nice head/bubbles. Nose of honey, floral hops. Taste is juniper, pine, florals. Finishes with spices and florals on the palette and a nice body.
Cloud rust color with a thin off-white head. Aroma of hops and fruit blend with a flavor to match.
Bottle from bu11zeye.  The smell is very grainy, some malts, hops, ok combo.  The look is cloudy, copper colored, and has a whitish head.  The taste is malts, hops, slight citrus, not bad.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2009 Draught at Harajuku Taproom. Clear red/amber - offwhite head. Bitterness, amber malts, wet dog, light hoppy, caramel, toffee, sweetness, toasted, orange, fruity, light grainy....... And as Baird - Bay Stream Lager (are you sure its the same beer, they had Red Rose and Bay Steam on tap at the same time ???). Clear amber - offwhite head. Dried fruits, plums, figs, raisins, malty sweetness, light hoppy. (7/3/3/7/14)
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  poured a hazy amber with a white head.  aroma of grains, caramel, and some slight citrus with the flavor being much the same.  light body.

Bottle from Sams Quik Shop in Durham, NC. Pours a very hazy brownish-rose color. Aroma is caramel, faint grain and a tart floral note. Taste is caramel, bitter, leafy hops, tea, nuts and bread. Medium bodied. There are the faintest signs of what may be infection.

Bottle @ Hashigo Zake. Pours amber... Off white head. 
Nice hoppy citrus nose, bit of biscuity malt. Initial flavour is nice, with a fair bit of zesty hops and toasted malt. However it seems truncated, when the bitterness is brief and finish negligible.
Tasty, clean and very drinkable. This one does grow on you. I could have a few for sure.
Courtesy of bu11zeye. Hazy amber with a white head. Spicy caramel aroma is lightly sweet. Medium body. Yeasty, spicy caramel flavors with light pit fruit notes. Not too bad.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Bottle.  Woah here is a gusher.  Immediately upon opening fridge kept for days on end it explodes over the top releases its contents on my hands and table.  Metallic tin and not much more.  Wow drain pour instantly.  Horrid.
Bottle from bu11zeye. Hazy orange brown pour with white head. Aroma is caramel, plums. Flavor is slightly sweet, light caramel, off metallic flavor.s
Bottle from bu11zeye.  Muddy brown pour.  Good fruity, caramel aroma.  Watery, metallic taste.  Smooth citrus finish.

( 12oz bottle )  Pours a murky amber-brown body with a small white head.  Aroma of pear, caramel, herbs, earth, and toasted grain.  Flavor of caramel, grain, light metallic, some citrus, and earthiness.

Bottle courtesy of bu11zeye. Clouded yellow orange pour. Healthy amount of head. Smell of sweet hops with a large floral face. Also has a chalky Play-doh feel too. Taste is fairly sweet flowers with a distasteful dandelion stem taste. Weedy....interesting.

Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Pours with a small tan head over a muddy, mud colored body. Aroma of toffee, caramel, plums and straw. Taste is sweet, fruity, caramel and a bit of fruit/citrus hops. Medium carbonation, crisp mouthfeel.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a large sized head of foamy finely sized tan colored bubbles that were and left behind a hazy with with yeast swirls . The weak aroma was mild malt. The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish. The thin flavor contained notes of mild hops and brown malt. An OK brew just nothing special.
Bottle 35,5 cl. Hazy amber golden with a tall and dense beige head leaving laces. Lightly nutty nose. Medium body, nuts, roasted malts and a little caramel. Dry, lightly hoppy finish. 120709

Date: August 08, 2009
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, Ticker
Appearance: hazy amber, lasting creamy off white head, drippy lace
Aroma: dry caramel malt aroma, lots of earthyness, light spicyness, touch of citrus
Flavor: dry caramel malt flavor, lots of woodsy earthyness, light bitterness, hint of balancing sweetness
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 11/20
Rating: 3/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: *4

Pours a clear amber with medium off-white head.  Aroma of hops.  Flavor also of spicy hops and rich malts with a slightly bitter finish.  Its a shame they dont have a wide distribution in Japan or elsewhere, its pretty good.

Medium sized, 12oz bottle.  Tall head on an amber colored beer.  Pleasant lacing.  Hoppy aroma.  Nice citrus and florals.  Flavor is a rich sweet malt.  Finishes dry.  Chewy mouthfeel.  Medium bodied.
Cloudy clay color with a thick tan head and pillowy top.  Aroma of roasted malt and some perfumey floral hops.  Flavor has bitter hops and caramel malt.  Palate has a lingering, bitter finish.
Pours a nice deep amber color with a tan head.  Aroma is caramel, floral, and fruity.  Flavor is caramel, toast, and a light floral spicy finish.

12 fl oz bottle. Pours hazy dark orange to light brown with a small white head. Dry malty and slight fruity aroma. Sweet malty, light fruity and with a minor bitter note. Ends dry and slight acidic finish.

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a huge orangey head. The aroma is sweet wtih citrusy notes of hops as well as light notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and some dusty hops, leading to a dry and lightly bitter finish.

Another pretty standard beer from this brewery.  Amber pour.  Toasted bread, caramel, citrus, slight sweetness, and hops.  Well balanced amber, doesnt seem to much like the other CA commons that I have had.

Appearance: Pours a hazy, reddish-amber body with a frothy, sudsy, off-white head. Fair amount of lace on the way down.

Smell: Oven-toasted biscuits with a very distant kick of dark caramel and fruit boosted by hoppy scents of spice, citrus, coarsely chopped herbs, and wood.

Taste: Toasted, day-old biscuits with hints of dry caramel. Touch of Tomcot apricots. Hop profile displays full tastes of zesty, zippy spices and citrus. Also, maybe, just maybe, even a tad woody. Medium-high bitterness thats bold but not overbearing. The toasty qualities try to reemerge past the spice, citrus, and staunch bitterness, but its to no avail. Finishes dry and bitter with a lingering toasty biscuitiness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: Delightfully quaffable -- one of those beers that its hard to finish the review before I clear through the entire bottle. My first Baird beer and a rather good one! Heres hoping the other three I purchased are as pleasant.

Bottle from the Sams in Downers Grove, Illinois:  This poured a dull amber body with a respectable beige head.  Had some floaties in it.  It had an aroma of floral scents, toasted grain, and a squirt of pink grapefruit juice.  A nicely balanced flavor, leaning towards a floral bitterness near the end.  Nice drink.

Draught at Baird Naka-Meguro Taproom.  Hazy nut nrown, creamy head. Perfumy hops covers a midsized rounded body where grainy malt fillsout the costume. Lightly fruity, floral with some black currant. Fairly bitter finish.

Extremely heady, over flow and long lasting. Dark amber body. Nose of pine roses and other floral hops, barley malt and a winey sweetness. Taste was quite hoppy, wood, pine, vinous and a bit sweet. Nice. Soft palate with a very long finish of grassy hops.

Generous, tight-bubbled head that remains rocky throughout the tasting.  Lots of chunky lace on the glass.  The color red-orange amber with a solid haze.

Sweet, hoppy and attractive.  Floral aroma of fresh hop cones.  Enough malt to make it very balanced.  Close to perfection.

Beautiful bitter.  The malt is present but in the background.  The hop, if I am hyper-critical, is leaning toward the harsh side.  Extraordinarily drinkable.  If I were to have a complaint, it would be that the liquor is on the thin side for such a flavorful beer.  Still, this is an exceptional beer well worth seeking out.
bit of astringent all around along with a touch of soap. but besides that is many flavors of caramel and really hoppy bitterness. some caramel. better than average yet not outstanding.

The aroma is malty and papery with hops to balance. The appearance is amber and cloudy with a foamy head. The flavor is like the aroma but not all together pleasant. The palate is typical for the style. Overall this is OK but I am not sure its a california common.

12oz. Bottle::  Aroma of malts, toasting, hops, light caramel, and a touch of brown sugar.  Poured amber/copper in color with a small to medium-sized off-white head that lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of tiny particles throughout.  Flavor is lightly sweet.  Tastes of malts, toasting, light cookie, slight tobacco, flower leaves, and tea.  Medium body.  Slightly chalky texture.  Average carbonation.  Malty, floral finish is lightly chalky.

pours amber, beige head, thick.
Aroma is malty, hoppy with fresh citrus notes. Retain the familiar Baird yeast aroma.
Taste, malty, followed by some floral sweetness, caramel malts, keep a good malt profile.
Thin yeasty deposit in the bottle.
murky muddy rust color under a huge fizzy beige head.  peachy hops aroma.  flavor is hoppy with floral peach notes and some spicy malts and pepper.  crisp and spicy palate.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2012 Overall , it just reminds me a little bit of a home brew gone a little a stray.  The nose has a very floral bouquet which is pretty common with some home brews.   The aftertaste has a nector flavor from a poorly brewed lager.  I had a lot of trouble getting past these issues which really held me back from saying anything very positive about the brew.  Will defeintely try another from this brewery, but likely wont purchase this again. 

11/2012: Tried it again and I feel th same way as I originally rated it.  Just soemthing about it that turns me off.

Bottle. Pour was a medium sized tan fizzy head with poor retention, splotchy amount of lacing, transparent, visible carbonation, and an orange hue. The aroma malty, caramel, citrus hops, pine, and fruity. The flavor was malty, citrus hops, fruity, crisp, somewhat rich tasting, and a dry finish. Smooth texture and medium bodied. An easy to drink beer, decent balance and okay for the style.

Bottle.  Pours clear amber with a large, foamy, off-white head, mostly diminishing with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread, husky grain, cereal), heavy hops (flowers, perfume, pine, citrus), average yeast (sweat) with notes of apricot, apple, and pear.  Medium bodied, sticky texture, lively carbonation, and a bitter finish.  Average duration, light sweetness, moderate acidity and bitterness.

Not getting the fruit aroma that others are reporting. However I definitely get the caramel and pine notes. This goes down really easy and smooth. I would of liked just a bit more alcoholic bite on this.

Bottle from Jungle Jim’s. Poured clear copper color with a large white frothy head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate citrus hoppy and light malty aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy balanced flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Solid drinkable brew and a standout for style.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2011 Bottle from the brewery. 
Dark amber colorapproaching dark brown. Wide, bubbly head. Amber malt aroma, hops, cherry, slightly earthy, some pine. Medium bodieda little too thin, medium richness. Bubblegum, cherry fruitiness, with decent light roasted malt flavor, and very good hops. Overall impression is dry, with decent fruit and a touch of sweetness. Finish is very dry and hoppy and lasts a long time. Well done.
Nice pour with good lacing and foam.  Slight sweetness in the flavor with a touch of fruitiness.
Clear amber with large beige head.sweet aroma with toasted malt, spices and caramel notes. Spicy flavour wiith hoppy malty and caramel notes. Finished bitter.
A solid sweetish beer. Whilst unexceptional for the style I wouldnt pass it up if offered. Has a nice fruity nose on it but doesnt really deliver the the malty caramel flavour I like in this style

(12oz bottle) Large off-white head atop clear amber body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, earthy, plum, some toast, light caramel.  Taste is medium sweet, earthy, raisin/plum, some caramel, light orange.  Smooth light-medium body, some stickiness.

Bottle from PC Market of Choice in Eugene, OR. Amber color with a creamy off-white head. Light and airy aromas of citrus and pine. Near full bodied with almost chewy carbonation. Flavor is spicy caramel with lots of citrus and resin hop. Flavors stick til the finish, which is dry and awesome bitter - but tingly rather than harsh. Just most brilliant. Every sip is a treat.

Pours an amber color with an off-white head.  Aroma is of caramel malts and citrus hops.  Light but balanced.  Flavor is also light with caramel malts and citrus hops.  Flavor doesn’t linger as long as I thought it would.  Good but not great.

355 ml. Foggy, dark ruby-tinted copper color with a three-finger creamy head that lasts well. Big aroma of caramel, citrus hop, cocoa, grape and apple. Taste has not quite so much depth: more resin, wood, tea leaf and citrus than the aroma indicates, with a slight caramel-apple note. The blend of these flavors leaves a long finish of bitter resin and toasted nut. Medium body is watery, a tad too fizzy, and finishes almost astringently dry. Wow, the look and smell of this one is great but the taste and mouthfeel just dont hold up their end. A nice brew that is much better than Anchor Steam, but somewhat of a tease that disappoints after the exciting foreplay. Not really worth the asking price ($4.99).

Taste 7/8 Bottle(date?) Looks: Amber body, nice thick creamy head. Aroma: Crisp. Spicy and floral hops. A little sour and sweet. Taste: Medium bodied. Fresh, hoppy and smooth. Very crisp and spicy, with a nice malt layering. Somewhere between an ESB/Premium Bitter and an IPA. I enjoyed it. Both sour and malty, with lots of citrus and spice.
Slightly hazy copper pour with a fluffy beige head.  Roasted caramel malts on the nose. Citrus hops well balanced with caramel malts.

Dark copper body with a medium khaki head. The aroma has some rish notes of roasted peanuts and black tea. There is also some pear character. The taste was largely black tea with some notes of almonds. There is also a faint hint of citrus, but it’s behind that tea character. nicely balanced and malty, this is not on the hoppy end of ambers.
OK amber ale, pours amber/copper with a small off-white head. Citrus hops with a slight tea note to it. Malts balance well with the fruity hops.
Bottle, shared by eyedrinkale.  Blond / amber color with some head.  Aroma is grainy malt, some caramel malt, and light citric fruit.  Flavor is similar, grainy malt with a little sweetness as well.

Bottle from EDA. Pours with a nice head. Dank, wet hop aroma, a bit watery, some dry rice. Cherry Tree flavor, steamy body, shells, clam, finishing hops. Pretty enjoyable stuff. My second California Common, after some 1500 ratings :O

Good looking copper with a thick tan head.  Sweet fruity aroma, citrus, caramel, malts.  Nice.  Full body, with nice carbonation.  Tastes of light fruit, citrus hops, and some light malt background.  Finishes with a decent hop bite.    Baird makes some fine brews.
The bottle foamed up upon opening.  Hazy light copper color.  Light hopped aroma.  The flavor had a malty start with a citrus hop finish.  Mildly bitter.

Bottle courtesy of daijokey... much appreciated.  Deep amber colour, thin white head.  Sweet honeyed malts, very light flavour with a soft herbal character.  A honey/malty sweetness.  Flinty bitterness on the back.

Thanks to daijokey for bringing this to JoeMcphees place for CaptainCougar come to NY gathering. This was the first of many japanese beers and I am really happy to have tried them, thanks a lot Wayne. Thick pale color.  An orange-marmalade aged maltiness.  Lightly citrus hops with citrus malt.  Aftertaste is hoppy citrus aftertaste.  The thing is the citrus is not American hop or not standard anyway.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: orange red pour with a fluffy off white head.  nose is definately more hoped then i expected citrus pine.  flavors are consitant witht he nose citrus grass with a mellow malt backbone. good reminds me more of a pale ale.
Very decent beer.  Not too hoppy like some American ambers, but still hoppy enough.  Good mouthfeel and head retention.  Very drinkable lager.

RBSG 2005.

Body is medium amber.

Aroma is moderately malty (cookie, caramel), lightly hoppy (flowers, apricot), with a note of wood.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Not bad, if unremarkable.
clear copper.  aroma of orange citrusy hops.  not much else in the flavour save for a little caramel and toastiness.  not bad, but a bit of a one trick pony.

Dark amber, gentle off-white head. Sweetish fruity nose has a rather dull orangey and sweaty hoppiness. Light bodied, gentle citrus fruits in the tongue, simple refreshing flavors, though the tart bite seems to work better than in the nose.

RBSG 05.  Thanks to Tim.  Deep copper with nice head.  Aroma is lightly hopped and sweet malt.  Medium hop flavor with some citrus, pine, and a little earthy.  Good light malt profile throughout.  Overall well balanced with a nice mildly bitter aftertaste.  Pretty well done for a steam beer.

Amber gold with fizzy white top. Light hop character, some spice and fruit character, malt works well as a filler .Hop character is there but not as bold as you might think. Chewy malts. Pleasant brew.
Big head. Cloudy dark copper. Floating particles. Very hoppy and tasty. Big surprise since the word amber makes me nervous.

RBSG 2005. Hazy amber, small off white head. Very hoppy aroma, citrus, leaves. Grapefruit emerges more in the flavour, almost too much so, overshadowing any malt contributions. Not well balanced but interesting. Average palate.
RBSG 2005: Poured light brown with a medium tan head. Mild hop aroma. Flavor is lightly chemical with a slight bitter finish. Mild hops. Good. Thanks to Tim for bringing this.
A dark amber color, piled high with Colombus with pine, lemon and earthy nose.  The mouth is dry and piney with a piney finish.

The most dissapointing of the Baird beers. Not terrible though. Looks ok, nice light brown colour. However, there's probably a little too much hops in this to balance the rest of it... i can hardly taste any maltiness and this is an amber ale! Anyway, a nice drink but look elsewhere in the Baird range.
